intro: Oxalis segetalis, commonly known as the field wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage and flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their delicate appearance. Oxalis segetalis is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural fields.
